<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Magnifying Glass of Elucidation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1438)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 110</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The magnifying glass of elucidation is available for purchase for any common languages, as well as any other languages to which a PC has gained access._

**Price** 125 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These well-aged wooden magnifying glasses are engraved with a variety of runes. Each is imbued with a specific language. When you use a magnifying glass to examine writing of its imbued language, it translates the writing into a language you understand. For example, an elf who speaks only [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4) using a _magnifying glass of elucidation_ imbued with [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3) would see Dwarven writing as Elven when observed through the magnifying glass. The magnifying glass only provides direct translations and doesn't automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages—you still need to attempt a skill check to [Decipher Writing](/Actions.aspx?ID=22).

<document level="2" id="action-1087" />

**Craft Requirements** You know the language imbued in the magnifying glass.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Magnifying Glass of Elucidation
